result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sharon M Marks  Guinn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Sharon M Marks  Guinn
Current: 2950 Clearwater Ln, Apt. 201, Waukesha, WI 53189 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2016)
Prior: 432 Nw Barstow St. #1, Waukesha, WI 53188
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Voss.

Defendant Sharon M Marks  Guinn in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #15CM75

Defendant Sharon M Marks  Guinn in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Voss requests an adjourned date so Defendant can continue with counseling.  Court adjourns.  Court sets this case along with jury status date on Case #15CM75. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Sharon M Marks  Guinn in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Voss states he still has not received discovery and requests an adjournment.  Defendant wishes a 60 day adjournment so she can obtain private counsel. Court adjourns  for 30 days.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Voss has been appointed. Defendant to pay: $50/month commencing on 07/01/15.

Defendant Sharon M Marks  Guinn in court.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states she wishes to request a court appointed attorney.  Court passes case so Defendant can fill out form.
Court re-calls case at 12:50 p.m..  Court grants Defendant's request for court appointed and orders appointment of counsel.  Defendant to pay for such counsel at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 7/1/15 and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Court sets review date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Sharon M Marks  Guinn in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
